# startSynchronously(name:priority:_:) | Apple Developer Documentation

- [ Swift ](/documentation/swift)

- [ Task ](/documentation/swift/task)

- [ startSynchronously(name:priority:_:) ](/documentation/swift/task/startsynchronously(name:priority:_:)-47sar)

- [ Task ](/documentation/swift/task)

-  startSynchronously(name:priority:_:) 

Type Method# startSynchronously(name:priority:_:)

iOS 26.0+iPadOS 26.0+Mac Catalyst 26.0+macOS 26.0+tvOS 26.0+visionOS 26.0+watchOS 26.0+

```
@discardableResult
static func startSynchronously(
    name: String? = nil,
    priority: TaskPriority? = nil,
    _ operation: sending @escaping @isolated(any) () async throws -> Success
) -> Task<Success, any Error>
```

Available when `Success` conforms to `Sendable` and `Failure` is `any Error`.Deprecated

Deprecated spelling of Task.immediate. This method will be removed.
